pageContext.title: In brief: Path is dead
pageContext.content:
Following the shuttering of Klout earlier this year, Path, the one-time rival to Facebook, is now closing its doors, according to an announcement made today. (Yes, you may be surprised to learn that Path was still alive.)

Source: TechCrunch

Launched November 2010, the pioneer of emoji reactions was already on a death spiral by May 2015 when the US-based app was acquired by the South Korean firm behind KakaoTalk.

That acquisition was a last gasp at Path’s salvation in Indonesia, where it had gathered a cult following.

Path will be removed from the app stores on October 1, then the lights will go out on October 18.

More social media action:

  • Tik Tok is taking over the world
  • In China, a new app is taking on WeChat
  • Facebook now has 500m people using it every day across Asia – but popularity is slowing
